TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed PageCountMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Represents values that control whether to calculate the actual page count or use an estimate.
Docs.remarks:
<!CDATA[
## Remarks Pagination in a processed report occurs when the report is rendered. Until the report is rendered, the total page count is unknown.
Rendering a report using the F:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.PageCountMode.Estimate?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True mode can help improve the performance of report rendering. You can change the P:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ReportViewer.PageCountMode?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True property of T:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ReportViewer?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True to control the page count mode it uses when rendering a report in the report area. To specify the page count mode when you render a report programmatically, use M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.Report.Render(System.String,System.String,Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.PageCountMode,System.String@,System.String@,System.String@,System.String[]@,Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.Warning[]@)?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True. You can then use the M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.Report.GetTotalPages?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True method to retrieve the total number of pages in the rendered report.
> [!NOTE] > Rendering in F:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.PageCountMode.Estimate?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True mode can be more performant than F:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.PageCountMode.Actual?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True mode
]>

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.PageCountMode Actual = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Calculate the actual page count for the report.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.PageCountMode Estimate = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Provide an estimate of the page count for the report instead of calculating the actual page count.
